items.text: plants it full on leg stump, defends
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: he walks after being caught behind! Goes for a wild sweep, but finds himself reaching out for the ball. Jadeja - clever, unstoppable Jadeja - slows it all the way down, dangles it in front of the batsman who goes for a rank slog sweep and toe-ends it through to the keeper. Good work from Dhoni, great change of pace from Jaddu. He's one shy of a five-for
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mosaddek Hossain, OUT

dismissal.text: Mosaddek Hossain c †Dhoni b Jadeja 12 (43b 0x4 0x6) SR: 27.90

items.preText: Slip, leg slip crowd Mehidy, the new batsman
items.text: goes back to block a full length ball on leg stump
items.postText: Now leg slip moves to short leg
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: good length on off stump, defends to point
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: loopy delivery on off stump, he digs it out well
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: drives it past the left of silly point for a single
items.postText: Rishabh: "Is Rohit's captaincy in rotating bowlers is better than Kohli? Or is it just disciplined bowling on the bowlers' part?" --- That... is a pretty cool question. I'm not sure I have the answer to it, other than perhaps India have the benefit of Dhoni in limited-overs cricket and he's spectacular at reading batsmen and very aware of where to place fielders when a spinner is on
items.shortText: Jadeja to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

items.text: good length on off stump, defends to point
items.shortText: Kumar to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: falls short of short midwicket with Karthik diving forward. Mehidy gets away with a flick
items.shortText: Kumar to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 2 runs

items.text: keeper comes up to the stumps as Bhuvi keeps it wicket to wicket. Mehidy works it to mid-on
items.postText: Suresh Guna: "@Rishabh : Rohit stil loves to do his MI ipl style captaincy, chop and change the bowlers, it works so far for India!!"
items.shortText: Kumar to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: drives on the up and to the left of cover. Looks good at the crease, does Mehidy
items.postText: Ajay: "@rishabh - think so ... you can clearly see in ipl too, Rohit is able to extract more out of the available resources and make lesser mistakes "
items.shortText: Kumar to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

items.text: goes short against Mashrafe, who ignores it outside off. Square leg umpire Raza calls it the first bouncer of the over
items.shortText: Kumar to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: back of a length and outside off, no shot
items.shortText: Kumar to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.preText: Bharath Seervi says: Bangladesh batsmen averaging under 18 this tournament, their lowest in any series/tournament in four years."

Bharath Seervi says: Bangladesh batsmen averaging under 18 this tournament, their lowest in any series/tournament in four years."

Snehil: "Jadeja is making a statement here. In the Tests, he got his chance because of Ashwin's injury, and now he is making a comeback in the ODI team through Pandya's injury."
items.text: handsome shot, over square leg! Mehidy looks like a boss when the ball is on his pads. He whips the No.1-ranked ODI bowler with supreme ease for straying in line just a tiny bit
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, FOUR runs

items.text: stands up tall against a rising delivery outside off and crunches it to cover point.
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: fine shot! He gets up off his toes to deal with a short ball outside off and has the presence of mind to keep his late cut down with third man on the boundary. Sensible batting... and Bangladesh have had to wait until their No. 9 for it
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

items.text: looks for the yorker on leg stump, doesn't quite get it there. Mashrafe flicks it to deep square leg
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 run

items.text: bouncer outside off, Mehidy lets it go and offers a wry smile when it's called one for the over.
items.postText: Ramble: "I've always heard the purpose of DRS is to eliminate the bad decision. And yet we still have batsman having to walk off the field LBW when they've clearly hit the ball. I sometimes wonder about the people at the ICC, and whether a bunch of high school kids couldn't do much better. "
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: lifts it over the lone slip fielder and finds a second boundary in the over. Why is he hiding in the Bangladesh tail? Clearly shows he's capable against the short ball as he ramps it over Dhawan
items.shortText: Bumrah to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, FOUR runs

items.text: good length legbreak on off stump, Mashrafe defends, reading the turn off the pitch
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: toe-ends his cut shot having made room against a ball pitching on leg stump and being surprised by it when it turns the wrong way
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mashrafe Mortaza, 1 run

items.text: tosses up the legbreak outside off, Mehidy strides forward to smother the turn
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, no run

items.text: sweeps a well flighted delivery on middle away to deep square leg - his footwork is so good that he gets to the ball on the full
items.postText: Tim: "As an Australian it's great seeing India dominate with sub continent specialists like Jadeja and Dhawan cos you just know this series will book them a tour down under and skiddy left arm orthodox won't do any good down under"
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mehidy Hasan Miraz, 1 run

items.text: beats him with the googly, tossing it up on off stump, not allowing Mashrage the liberty of picking the ball off the surface
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mashrafe Mortaza, no run

items.text: nudges it behind square leg
items.postText: Sundar S: "@Ramble: If you use up your review for the not-bad decisions, you can hardly complain. Having said that, DRS or no DRS, the man in the middle is supposed to make the correct decision. The presence of DRS is not an excuse for the on-field umpire to make a bad decision."
items.shortText: Kuldeep Yadav to Mashrafe Mortaza, 2 runs
